issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

fields.description:
Test Steps :

Below commands are not getting captured in the Router logs.
 # Destination entry name in the add command. Log says "Added new mount point /apps9 to resolver".
 # Safemode enter|leave|get commands
 # nameservice enable
fields.summary: RBF: Router logs are not capturing few of the dfsrouteradmin commands

comments.body:
Thanx [~SoumyaPN] for raising the issue.
The logs were missing for safemode and nameservice were missing have added them.
The first part regarding missing the destination entry name in the add command logs feels like deliberate might be done to prevent the exposure of the actual location in the cluster.
Have Uploaded the patch with logs for other commands.
Does it make sense to log the negative cases?

Thanks for the comment [~elgoiri]. Here we are logging the positive successful scenarios like 
 # Nameservice enable/disable
 # Router safemode enter/leave/get

Could you please tell what negative cases you are talking about ?  :)

bq. Could you please tell what negative cases you are talking about ?  

When {{success==false}}. Are those worth mentioning?
IMO, better to have for failure case also.(i.e when {{success==false}}).

[^HDFS-13862-03.patch] LGTM.
The failure in {{TestRouterWebHDFSContractAppend}} is unrelated and already tracked in HDFS-13404.
+1

[~ayushtkn] thanks for updating the patch.

Instead of following, how about "*STATE* Safe mode is ON.It was turned on manually.*" and giving tip to get out safemode which will be similar to namenode.? ( can address all the safemode log messages like that..?)
|287|LOG.info("Entered safemode successfully");|

[~elgoiri] what you think..?

In general, I try to follow whatever the Namenode does to keep it consistent.
The STATE one I think is the way the NN does, so I would go in that direction.

Thanx [~brahmareddy] for the suggestions & [~elgoiri] for the discussion.
Have updated the patch as per the comments.
Pls Review!!!
